intro: Corpuscularia angustipetala, commonly known as the narrow-petioled corpuscularia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
